abstract: Lehman Brothers bankruptcy administrators are preparing for a series of legal fights against other banks which have filed more than $50 billion in claims for losses related to derivatives contracts, The Wall Street Journal reported.
snippet: Lehman Brothers bankruptcy administrators are preparing for a series of legal fights against other banks which have filed more than $50 billion in claims for losses related to derivatives contracts, The Wall Street Journal reported.
lead_paragraph: A team of Lehman Brothers bankruptcy administrators are gearing up to wage a series of legal fights against other banks this year, which have filed more than $50 billion in claims for losses related to derivatives contracts, The Wall Street Journal reported.

headline.main: Lehman Set to Fight Bank Derivatives Claims
